alert.note: Alert for Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 9:58AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Woodward County through 1030 AM CDT... At 957 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm just northeast of Woodward, moving east at 5 mph. Another storm was developing over Quinlan. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodward, Mooreland, and Quinlan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
